eg.syntax

Class Coloring

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.syntax.Coloring

  • public class Coloring
extends java.lang.Object
    The search and coloring of different syntax elements

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Coloring(javax.swing.text.StyledDocument doc, javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
      Creates a Lexer

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Searches and colors in green block comments

      Searches the brackets and displays them in bold blue

      • Coloring

        public Coloring(javax.swing.text.StyledDocument doc,
                javax.swing.text.SimpleAttributeSet set)
        Creates a Lexer
        Parameters:
        doc - the StyledDocument that contains the text to color
        set - the SimpleAttributeSet that has the normal (black, plain) style

    • Method Detail

      • setColorable

        public void setColorable(Colorable colorable)
        Sets a Colorable
        Parameters:
        colorable - a Colorable object

      • colorMultipleLines

        public void colorMultipleLines(java.lang.String allText,
                               java.lang.String section,
                               int pos)
        Colors a subset of lines or the entire text (in any case the entire text is scanned for block comments). To scan the entire text section is equal to allText or null.
        Parameters:
        allText - the entire text of the document
        section - a section of allText. If null allText is used. The complete lines are colored even if it does not start a line start or end at line end
        pos - the pos within the document where a change happened.

      • colorLine

        public void colorLine(java.lang.String allText,
                      int pos)
        Colors the current line where a change happened (the entire text is scanned for block comments though).
        Parameters:
        allText - the entire text of the document
        pos - the pos within document where a change happened

      • setCharAttrBlack

        public void setCharAttrBlack()
        (Re-)colors in black this section of text that is to be colored

      • setAllCharAttrBlack

        public void setAllCharAttrBlack()
        (Re-)colors in black the entire text

      • keywordsRed

        public void keywordsRed(java.lang.String[] keys,
                        boolean reqWord)
        Searches and colors keywords in red
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - if the keyword must be a word

      • keywordsBlue

        public void keywordsBlue(java.lang.String[] keys,
                         boolean reqWord)
        Searches and colors keywords in blue
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        reqWord - if the keyword must be a word

      • signedKeywordsBlue

        public void signedKeywordsBlue(java.lang.String[] signs,
                               char[] endChars)
        Searches and colors variables that start with a sign in blue (like $ in Perl)
        Parameters:
        signs - the array of characters that marks a variable
        endChars - the array of characters that mark the end of the variable

      • htmlTags

        public void htmlTags(java.lang.String[] tags)
        Searches and colors html tags in blue
        Parameters:
        tags - the array of tags

      • htmlKeywords

        public void htmlKeywords(java.lang.String[] keys,
                         java.lang.String blockStart,
                         java.lang.String blockEnd)
        Searched and colors keywords in red in a html document
        Parameters:
        keys - the array of keywords
        blockStart - the String that represents the start of a block where the keyword must be found in
        blockEnd - the String that represents the end of a block where the keyword must be found in

      • bracesGray

        public void bracesGray()
        Searches the braces and displays them in bold gray

      • bracketsBlue

        public void bracketsBlue()
        Searches the brackets and displays them in bold blue

      • quotedText

        public void quotedText()
        Searches and colors quoted text in orange. The quote mark is ignored if a backslash precedes it

      • quotedTextHtml

        public void quotedTextHtml()
        Searches and colors quoted text in a html document, separating between values of attributes and quotes text in script parts. The quote mark is ignored if a backslash precedes it

      • lineComments

        public void lineComments(java.lang.String lineCmnt,
                         char exception)
        Searches and colors line comments in green
        Parameters:
        lineCmnt - the String that represents the start of a line comment
        exception - the character that disables the line comment when it precedes lineCmt. The null character to skip any exception

      • lineCommentsJavascriptInHtml

        public void lineCommentsJavascriptInHtml()
        Searches and colors line comments in green in javascript section of an html document

      • blockComments

        public void blockComments(java.lang.String blockStart,
                          java.lang.String blockEnd)
        Searches and colors in green block comments
        Parameters:
        blockStart - the String that represents the start of a block
        blockEnd - the String that represents the end of a block

      • isInBlock

        public boolean isInBlock(java.lang.String blockStart,
                         java.lang.String blockEnd)
        Returns if this pos where a change happened is found in a block of text that is delimited by the specified start and end signals
        Parameters:
        blockStart - the String that defines the block start
        blockEnd - the String that defines the block end
        Returns:
        if this pos is found in a certain block of text
